User Story: As a player, I want the system to automatically record important narrative events so I can review them later
Acceptance Criteria:
The system automatically creates journal entries for major narrative events
Each entry includes timestamp, world ID, character ID, and session ID
Entry content accurately reflects the narrative event
Entries are assigned the correct type ('narrative')
Narrative entries are formatted with proper paragraph structure
Technical Requirements: The system must capture and record important narrative events as they occur. Each journal entry must include essential metadata (timestamp, IDs) to establish context. The system must properly categorize entries as narrative events and format the content for readability
Implementation Considerations: Consider what constitutes an important narrative event worthy of recording versus minor events that might create clutter. Think about how to format narrative content to maintain readability while preserving the original meaning and tone. The recording process should be non-intrusive to the game experience

User Story: As a player, I want my decisions and their outcomes recorded so I can remember the choices I've made
Acceptance Criteria:
The system creates journal entries for all significant player decisions
Decision entries include both the choice made and its immediate outcome
Entries are correctly categorized with the 'decision' type
Decision entries include contextual information about the situation
The decision content is formatted for readability
Technical Requirements: The system must record significant player decisions and their outcomes. Journal entries must include both the choice made and its result. The system must categorize these entries appropriately and include sufficient contextual information about the situation that led to the decision
Implementation Considerations: Consider how to balance providing enough context about decisions without creating overly lengthy entries. Think about how to present decisions and outcomes in a way that helps players track their story arc. The formatting should distinguish decisions from other types of journal entries

User Story: As a player, I want to see when I discovered important information so I can track my progress
Acceptance Criteria:
The system creates journal entries when the player discovers significant information
Discovery entries are correctly categorized with the 'discovery' type
Discovery content clearly explains what was learned
Entries include timestamps to show when discoveries occurred
Discovery entries are formatted with proper paragraph structure
Technical Requirements: The system must identify and record significant discoveries made by the player. These entries must be categorized as discoveries and include clear explanations of the information learned. The system must timestamp these entries to establish when discoveries occurred
Implementation Considerations: Consider what criteria determine a significant discovery worth recording. Think about how to present discoveries in a way that emphasizes their importance without spoiling future content. Discovery entries should help players track their growing understanding of the game world

User Story: As a player, I want system events recorded so I have a complete history of my game session
Acceptance Criteria:
The system creates entries for session start and end events
System events include relevant metadata such as duration
Session boundary entries provide context about progress
System events are distinguishable from narrative events
System entries are formatted appropriately for their content
Technical Requirements: The system must record important system events such as session starts and ends. These entries must include relevant metadata about the session. System events must be clearly distinguishable from narrative content. The system must format these entries appropriately for their technical nature
Implementation Considerations: Consider which system events are meaningful to players versus those that are purely technical. Think about how to present system information in a way that feels integrated with the narrative journal entries. The formatting should make system events easily identifiable while maintaining the aesthetic of the journal

User Story: As a player, I want to see summaries of longer entries so I can quickly understand their content
Acceptance Criteria:
Long journal entries display a concise summary at the top
Summaries capture the key points of the full entry
Users can expand entries to view the complete content
Summaries are automatically generated for entries above a certain length
The summary format is consistent across all entry types
Technical Requirements:
Journal entry system with:
Automatic summary generation for lengthy entries
Collapsible/expandable entry display
Consistent formatting for entry summaries
Preservation of entry metadata in summary view
Implementation Considerations:
Use standard implementation approach for this feature
Consider AI-assisted summary generation for narrative entries
Ensure summaries maintain critical context while reducing length
Implement intelligent truncation that preserves meaning

User Story: As a player, I want my journal to persist between sessions so my story history is preserved
Acceptance Criteria:
Journal entries are saved to persistent storage automatically
Entries are correctly restored when returning to the game
The complete journal history is maintained across multiple play sessions
Entry metadata and formatting are preserved exactly
No entries are lost when switching between devices
Technical Requirements:
Journal system with:
Secure persistent storage implementation
Complete data serialization and deserialization
Cross-session state management
Robust error handling for data recovery
Implementation Considerations:
Use standard implementation approach for this feature
Implement efficient storage mechanisms for potentially large journals
Ensure backward compatibility as the journal format evolves
Consider incremental loading for performance with large journals

User Story: As a player, I want to access the journal during gameplay so I can remind myself of previous events
Acceptance Criteria:
The journal interface is accessible from the main gameplay screen
Opening the journal pauses the game appropriately
The journal opens smoothly without disrupting gameplay flow
Players can easily return to gameplay after reviewing the journal
Journal access is available at all appropriate points in the narrative
Technical Requirements:
Journal system with:
Accessible UI controls for journal access
Seamless integration with gameplay state management
Efficient rendering that doesn't impact game performance
Intuitive navigation between gameplay and journal views
Implementation Considerations:
Use standard implementation approach for this feature
Consider appropriate UI placement for journal controls
Ensure the transition between gameplay and journal is smooth
Implement state preservation when switching between views

User Story: As a player, I want to browse journal entries chronologically so I can follow the story progression
Acceptance Criteria:
Journal entries are displayed in chronological order by default
Users can sort entries from newest to oldest or oldest to newest
The interface clearly indicates the timestamp for each entry
Entries are grouped by session or day for easy navigation
The current sort order is clearly indicated in the UI
Technical Requirements:
Journal system with:
Flexible sorting capabilities for entries
Intuitive timeline-based navigation
Clear visual indicators for chronological sequence
Efficient handling of potentially large entry collections
Implementation Considerations:
Use standard implementation approach for this feature
Implement virtual scrolling for performance with many entries
Consider time-based grouping to improve navigation
Ensure sorting controls are intuitive and accessible
